content:
I just can't figure out, where this code is from: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/leaflet/blob/1.x-1.x/libraries/leaflet/leaflet-measure.js

And the person who merged this unknown library it is gone. I suspect, I'll have to remove it from the module. Or does anyone else figure out, where this comes from (and which license it uses)?

backdrop-contrib/leaflet
Integration with the Leaflet map scripting library. - backdrop-contrib/leaflet

FTR: I found all the other ones and can properly attribute: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/leaflet/tree/update-libraries/libraries/leaflet_plugins

But this leaflet-measure thing is impossible to find on Github and the git history is no help, either.

backdrop-contrib/leaflet
Integration with the Leaflet map scripting library. - backdrop-contrib/leaflet
You might have done this already but you could search the files in the Drupal module and related modules to see if you can trace it's origin that way.

@indigoxela I haven't looked too closely at the code but it seems similar to https://github.com/Qix-/color/blob/master/index.js

Qix-/color
:rainbow: Javascript color conversion and manipulation library - Qix-/color
Except the measure js is a lot longer. Oops. Does it contain multiple libraries cobbled together?
I was just randomly copying and searching some of the functions
Some of the functions seem to require external libraries which might not be included

I also searched in related Drupal modules, but no luck. As the code isn't actually used, I removed it. Maybe it was some experimental stuff in the early days, possibly quickly stuffed together... Anyway - as I can't figure out the source and license, I removed it. Nothing broke.
